page.title: 03Petition for change
page.content: There is a problem in Springholm because Regional Councillors have refused to change the speed limit from 40 mph to 30 mph. Mr Michael Ancram,Minister of State at the Scottish Office, has given his approval to improve warning signs and "series of bends" signs as well as to the possibility of widening the footpath. A petition was signed by nearly all the villagers who wanted the speed limit to be reduced. This was supported by the police, the local community council, the regional roads and transportation committee and the MP Mr Ian Lang, but unfortunately it was not obtained. No adequate reason was given. The nearby village of Crocketford (also on the A75) has a speed limit of 30 mph, so we would like the same.
